New Records: Jude Bellingham scored a crucial goal in stoppage time, rescuing England in a dramatic extra-time win over Slovakia.
Eberechi Eze's miscued shot was headed across the six-yard box by Ivan Toney, leading to Harry Kane's goal in extra time.
Key Match Events: Jude Bellingham scored an overhead kick in stoppage time to equalize for England.
Harry Kane scored in extra time to secure the win for England.
England turned the screw at the start of extra time after coming back from 1-0 down.
Ivan Schranz scored for Slovakia in the 25th minute to take the lead.
Pre-Game Insights: England fans felt the nerves at the outset, with the team struggling to move the ball and making errors.
The referee, Halil Umut Meler, showed early yellow cards, including one for Marc Guéhi, who will be suspended for the next match.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate praised his team's resilience after coming back from 1-0 down.
Southgate will bring up his 100th game as England's manager when his side faces Switzerland in the quarter-finals on Saturday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's performance was described as 'a tough watch' in the first half, with the team struggling to create chances.
The match was played in front of a crowd of 6,500 England fans, who were frustrated by the team's performance.
Others: England will face Switzerland in the quarter-finals on Saturday, with Gareth Southgate set to reach his 100th game as manager.
Marc Guéhi will be suspended for the next match after receiving his second yellow card of the tournament.
